required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acupuncture for Adults With Sickle Cell Disease (SCD): A Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Acupuncture for Adults With Sickle Cell Disease (SCD): A Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators long-term goal is to demonstrate the effectiveness of acupuncture for the treatment of adults with chronic pain of sickle cell disease (SCD), a debilitating pain syndrome characterized by acute and chronic pain. The objective of this study is to explore the feasibility and acceptability of acupuncture with adult sickle cell patients. The investigators will conduct the study with adults with chronic pain from SCD, 18 years old or greater. They will all receive acupuncture. Treatments will be twice weekly for 5 weeks for 30 minutes. At baseline and post-treatment, subjects will complete measures that include pain, fatigue, anxiety, depressive symptoms, injustice experience, and pain catastrophizing. Subjects will also complete a measure of study acceptability, the Protocol Acceptability Scale for Treating SCD with Acupuncture at post-treatment. The investigators will describe the procedures and potential challenges to implementing the acupuncture protocol and the range in the subjects' Acceptability Scale scores. The investigators will expect to identify and rectify any procedural problems subjects will report regarding the 10-session study protocol.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is an unblinded, uncontrolled trial.
study_design_info.masking_description: There is no masking. This study is unblinded.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Pain Intensity Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measures change in pain intensity from 0, no pain to 5, very severe. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Global Health Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in overall health from 5, excellent to 1, poor. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Pain Interference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in the amount that pain interferes with life from 1, not at all to 5, very bad. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Emotional Distress-Depression-Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in depression from 1, never to 5, always. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Emotional Distress-Anxiety
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in anxiety from 1, never to 5, always. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Emotional Distress-Anger
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in anger from 1, never to 5, always. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Sleep Disturbance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in sleep disturbance from 5, not at all to 1, very much. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Fatigue-Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in fatigue from 1, not at all to 5, always. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) General Self-Efficacy-Short Form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in the level of confidence in managing various situations, problems, and events from 1, not at to 5, always. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in thoughts and feelings you may experience when you think about your pain from 0, never to 4, all the time. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures change in the type of thoughts and feelings that you experience when you are in pain from 0, not at all to 4, all the time. Higher scores represent worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Interview Guide Regarding Subject's Feelings about Receiving Acupuncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Protocol Acceptability Scale for Treating Sickle Cell Disease with Acupuncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measures acceptability of the acupuncture protocol with 1, not hard, easy, not rushed, enjoyed, I liked it, not painful, I would get it again, others will enjoy, too short; to 3, too hard, did not enjoy, I didn't like, it was painful, I would not get again, others did not enjoy, too long. Higher scores indicate worse outcomes.

other_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 weeks
other_outcome.description: Measures change in pain intensity from 0, no pain to 10, pain as bad as it could be.

arm_group.description: All subjects will receive active acupuncture.

intervention.description: All subjects will receive a standardized 18 needle acupuncture protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with Sickle Cell Disease
- Receiving care at the University of Illinois Sickle Cell Disease clinic
- Moderate to severe level of pain (>3 on 0-10 scale) within the last 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Physically or cognitively unable to complete the study procedures

facility.name: University of Illinois at Chicago College of Nursing
